column3: Hizbirbaş) is a town in the Republic of Dagestan
column5: located on the coast of the Caspian Sea 56 kilometers (35 mi) southeast of Makhachkala
column6: the capital of the republic. Population: 55

column1: It was founded in 1932 as an oil extraction settlement. Town status was granted to it in 1949.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as the Town of Izberbash—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: the Town of Izberbash is incorporated as Izberbash Urban Okrug.

column1: Ethnic groups in the city administrative area (2002 census):
Azerbaijanis (1.0%)Ethnic groups in the city itself (2002 census):
Izberbash has a cold semi-arid climate (Köppen climate classification: BSk).
